intro: Pavetta involucrata, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in woodland and forested areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Pavetta involucrata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can be found in botanical gardens and private collections.
